interface.name: zriver_control_v1
interface.description:
This interface allows clients to run compositor commands and receive a success/failure response with output or a failure message respectively.
Each command is built up in a series of add_argument requests and executed with a run_command request. The first argument is the command to be run.
A complete list of commands should be made available in the man page of the compositor.

request.name: destroy
request.description: This request indicates that the client will not use the river_control object any more. Objects that have been created through this instance are not affected.

request.name: add_argument

description.summary: add an argument to the current command

request.description: Arguments are stored by the server in the order they were sent until the run_command request is made.

request.name: run_command
request.description: Execute the command built up using the add_argument request for the given seat.

interface.name: zriver_command_callback_v1
interface.description: This object is created by the run_command request. Exactly one of the success or failure events will be sent. This object will be destroyed by the compositor after one of the events is sent.

event.name: success
event.description: Sent when the command has been successfully received and executed by the compositor. Some commands may produce output, in which case the output argument will be a non-empty string.

event.name: failure
event.description: Sent when the command could not be carried out. This could be due to sending a non-existent command, no command, not enough arguments, too many arguments, invalid arguments, etc.

arg.name: failure_message
arg.summary: a message explaining why failure occurred
